title.narrative: NFIs for Poktap IDPs and host communities

description.narrative:
Since 2011, under the USAID Food for Peace (FFP) and South Sudan Mission funded Jonglei Food Security Program (JFSP), CRS and Save the Children US have been supporting livelihoods development in households and communities in eight counties of Jonglei. The program aims to facilitate participants move along a continuum from highly vulnerable, to vulnerable but viable, and eventually to entrepreneurial and thriving. Since the outbreak of massive, violent conflict in December 2013, food security in the conflict-affected areas of Greater Upper Nile (GUN) – the states of Jonglei, Unity and Upper Nile – has declined rapidly. Over 1 million South Sudanese have been displaced, including 301,900 in Jonglei state . The resulting core problem is that due to on-going violence, over 300,000 people in Jonglei state suffer from food insecurity and are at risk of famine. The intervention will target 2,200 vulnerable households living in Poktap Boma, Duk County, which include the elderly, female headed and child headed households, returnees and host communities. CRS (JFSP) has already structures in place working with local chief and RRC and therefore, the project team through the help of local authorities (chiefs) will carefully identify families who need assistance by validating their information through home visits and cross checking with other NGOs.
This proposed project aims to improve capacity of local leaders and committees on access to improve shelters. The committees and local leaders will encourage IDPs and returnees to construct/build shelters using available local materials.
